segments.text: I see the water spilling everywhere, and I feel a pit in my stomach.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is going to slip and fall if she doesn’t move soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is dangerously close to tipping that stool, and no one is stopping him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware everyone is in this kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting, like nothing bad could possibly happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the floor is going to be ruined by the time someone notices.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is drying dishes like it’s a normal day, but it’s anything but normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children will get hurt before she even realizes what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm, but inside, it’s a disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to step in and do something before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring and pouring, and no one is paying attention.
segments.speaker: PAR
